(5/5)

Auditors said the Army, Navy, and Air Force could account for the existence and completeness of major military equipment.
‚Ä¢ However, auditors found many material weaknesses including Property, Plant, and Equipment; Inventory; IT Systems Security; and Financial Reporting. 
(4/5)

I wanted to share some of the results of the audit with you:

‚Ä¢ Auditors did not report any material weaknesses for civilian or military pay.
‚Ä¢ Auditors said they found no evidence of fraud.
(3/5)

I believe an audit is a good thing - especially for a department as large as the DoD - because it allows us to identify ways to better manage our national defense resources, as well as finds issues Congress and the Pentagon can work together to address. (2/5)

Recently, the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) released the results of its first ever department-wide audit, which was conducted by approximately 1,200 auditors making more than 900 site visits to military bases, depots, warehouses, and more. (1/5)
